intro: Oestlundorchis rhombilabia subsp. tamayoi, commonly known as the Tamayo's orchid, is a rare and specialized orchid species native to specific regions of South America. It is characterized by its unique floral structure, featuring a resupinate flower with a distinctive bilabiate lip. The plant typically grows in humid, shaded environments, often in mountainous or forested areas. Its botanical features include slender, often hairy stems and lanceolate leaves. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a species of conservation concern.
